name: Accomplished Pose
benefits:
Accomplished Pose is an ideal position for meditation, suitable for staying in for long periods.
In this pose, the placement of the heels stimulates the root and sacral chakras, guiding the flow of energy upward.
description:
Sit on the floor with both legs together.
Lift the left foot and place it at the perineum.
Then lift the right foot and place it above the left foot.
To stabilize the posture, tuck the right toes into the space between the left calf muscles.
Ensure both knees are in contact with the floor.
Keep the spine upright.
Gently draw the chin toward the chest.
Focus the gaze between the eyebrows while paying attention to the breath. Breathing can be natural and deep, or you may practice Ujjayi Pranayama according to your meditation technique.
Place both hands on the knees, or form the Chin Mudra or Jnana Mudra if desired.
Stay in the pose until discomfort arises, adjusting the duration according to your comfort level.

name: Archer Pose
benefits:
Stretches the arms, hips, and legs.
Enhances the flexibility of the arms, shoulders, and hips.
description:
Begin in Staff Pose.
Use the first three fingers of the right hand to hook the right big toe, and the first three fingers of the left hand to hook the left big toe.
As you exhale, bend the right leg and right arm, lifting the knee upward and backward while keeping the left leg extended.
Continue breathing naturally while holding the pose.
On an exhale, slowly release the pose, then practice on the other side.

name: Baby Grasshopper Pose
benefits:
Helps relax the hip joints and increase hip flexibility.
Engages the abdominal muscles through balance and support.
Strengthens the legs, arms, and shoulders.
Gradually develops confidence to enter more advanced poses.
Enhances coordination and stability.
description:
Begin in Staff Pose with legs extended and hands at the sides.
Position the left hand on the floor behind the left hip, fingers pointing backward, as a support point.
Bend the right leg and place the right foot outside the left thigh, with the toes pointing left.
Reach the right hand forward to grasp the left ankle or the top of the foot.
Transfer the body weight onto the left hand and right foot. Inhale, lift the hips and left leg, and move the body forward.
Stay in this position for a few breaths, feeling balance and strength.
On an exhale, slowly lower the body back to the starting position. Repeat on the other side.

name: Balancing Bound Angle Pose
benefits:
Strengthens core, hips, and pelvic floor.
Increases flexibility and relieves tension.
Opens the hips, getting your body ready for more complex poses like Shoulderstand.
Engages the Root, Sacral, and Solar Plexus Chakras to enhance energy flow.
description:
Sit on your mat with legs extended.
Bring the soles of your feet together and hold your ankles.
Pull your heels as close to your groin as possible, holding your feet with interlaced fingers.
Inhale and lift your legs, keeping the soles of your feet together and your thighs parallel to the ground.
Keep your spine straight, chest lifted, and core engaged.
Take a few deep breaths, feeling your core activate and your hips stretch.
Exhale as you gently lower your legs. Straighten them to return to Staff Pose.

name: Balancing Butterfly Pose
benefits:
Stretches the soles of the feet and ankles to relieve fatigue.
Relaxes the hip joints and increases flexibility.
Builds coordination and stability by balancing on your tiptoes.
Engages your abdominal muscles to stabilize the body.
Works the muscles of your legs, especially the calves and inner thighs.
description:
Start standing with your feet together.
On an exhale, slowly squat down, keeping your feet together as you open your knees wide.
Lightly touch the floor with your fingertips for balance. Shift your weight onto the balls of your feet, lifting your heels while keeping your feet in contact.
Slowly lift your hands to a prayer position at your chest, then reach them up towards the sky.
Hold the pose, breathing deeply and feeling the stretch and balance.
To exit, lightly touch the floor again, bring your knees together, and inhale as you slowly rise back to standing.

name: Belly Twist Pose
benefits:
Strengthens the lower back, core, and legs, builds muscle strength.
Stretches the spine, pelvis, shoulders, and hips.
Promotes blood flow to the spinal region.
Relieves overall stiffness and tension.
Stimulates abdominal organs to improve digestion.
description:
Lie flat on your back with your arms stretched out at your sides, palms down.
Bend your knees and pull them towards your chest.
On an exhale, slowly lower your knees to one side.
Try to bring your knees closer to your same-side arm to deepen the twist.
Turn your head to the opposite side, looking toward your fingertips.
Hold the pose for a few deep breaths, feeling the twist and stretch.
On an inhale, slowly bring your knees back to your chest, then lower them on the exhale.
Repeat on the other side.

name: Bharadvaja’s Twist
benefits:
Enhances the flexibility of your spine and upper body while building stamina.
Alleviates stiffness and tension in the neck and shoulders through the twisting motion.
Promotes blood circulation to the abdominal organs, aiding digestion and detoxification.
Helps to relax the mind, ease stress, and soothe your nervous system.
description:
Sit on your mat with your legs extended in front of you.
Shift your weight onto one hip (e.g., your right hip).
Bend your left knee, placing your left foot outside your right leg with the ankle on the arch of your right foot.
On an inhale, twist your torso to the left, drawing your left shoulder back and your right shoulder forward.
Place your left fingertips on the floor behind you for support. Press your right hand against the outside of your left thigh to deepen the twist.
Turn your head to the left, gazing over your left shoulder.
Hold the pose for 5-10 deep breaths, feeling the twist and release.
On an exhale, slowly untwist back to center and return to Staff Pose.
Repeat on the other side for a balanced practice.
aka_chinese: ['巴拉瓦伽第一式','巴拉瓦伽扭转式']

name: Big Toe Pose
benefits:
Builds strength in your leg muscles.
Improves leg flexibility and relieves tension.
Massages abdominal organs to aid digestive function.
Relieves stress and anxiety, and soothes the nervous system.
Enhances the function of internal organs for overall health.
description:
Start in a standing position with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides.
On an exhale, fold forward from your hips.
Bend your elbows and grasp your big toes with your thumb, index, and middle fingers.
On an exhale, gently pull back on your toes to increase the stretch in your legs.
Hold the pose for at least 5 deep breaths, feeling the stretch and core engagement.
On an inhale, slowly straighten your body back to a standing position.
aka_chinese: ['手抓大脚趾站立前屈式','站立手抓大脚趾式','手触趾前曲伸展式']

name: Bird of Paradise Pose
benefits:
Increases flexibility in the hips, groin, and hamstrings.
Opens the chest and shoulders.
Strengthens the legs and core.
Improves balance and stability.
description:
Start in a standing position with your feet hip-width apart.
Fold forward and thread your left arm between your legs, reaching it back. Extend your right arm behind you and interlock your hands.
Shift your weight onto your right foot, planting it firmly on the ground.
On an inhale, lift your left foot and slowly rise to a standing position.
Slowly straighten your left leg, maintaining your balance and stability.
Hold the pose, breathing deeply and evenly, feeling your strength and stretch.
On an exhale, slowly lower your left leg back to your starting position.
Repeat the steps on the other side for a balanced practice.

name: Revolved Bird of Paradise Pose
benefits:
Increases flexibility in the hips, groin, and hamstrings.
Opens the chest and shoulders.
Strengthens the legs and core.
Improves balance and stability.
description:
Begin in a standing mountain pose with your feet firmly planted.
Shift your weight to one foot (e.g., your right foot), bending your other knee (your left knee) and preparing to lift it.
On an exhale, twist your torso, bringing one shoulder (your left shoulder) closer to your lifted knee (your left knee).
Wrap your other arm (your right arm) around your lifted thigh (your left thigh) to secure the twist.
On an inhale, straighten your lifted leg (your left leg), maintaining stability and stretch.
On an exhale, turn your head to look backward, deepening the twist.
Hold the pose for several deep breaths, feeling the twist and stretch.
On an exhale, slowly release the pose and return to your starting mountain pose. Repeat the steps on the other side.

name: Happy Baby Pose
benefits:
Relieves sacroiliac joint pressure.
Opens the hip joints, increasing flexibility.
Stretches the hamstrings, pelvic floor, and inner groin.
Releases tension in the spine and sacrum.
description:
Lie on your back with your legs bent and your feet flat on the floor.
Bring the soles of your feet towards the ceiling, keeping your knees naturally bent.
Grasp the outer edges of your feet with your hands, or hook your big toes with your fingers if you can't reach.
Gently pull your feet down to create a slight stretch, but avoid over-exertion.
Relax your shoulders away from your ears.
Gently push your chest up towards the ceiling to keep it open.
Keep your neck relaxed, avoiding any tension.
Hold the pose for a few seconds to a few minutes, breathing deeply and evenly.
On an exhale, slowly release the pose and return to a supine position.

name: Double Big Toe Pose
benefits:
Enhances core strength and stability.
Stretches the legs, hamstrings, and calves, relieving tension.
Improves balance and focus.
Aids digestive function by massaging abdominal organs.
Strengthens the spine and shoulders to improve posture.
description:
Sit on the floor with your legs straight in front of you and your back straight.
Bend your knees, bringing your feet closer to your hips.
Grasp your big toes with your index, middle, and thumb fingers.
On an inhale, lift your feet off the ground, bringing your legs close to your sitting bones. Slowly straighten your legs to form a 45-60 degree angle with your torso, creating a 'V' shape.
Keep your sitting bones grounded and roll your shoulder blades back and down to open your chest. Engage your core and keep your spine long, avoiding rounding your back.
Hold the pose for 3-5 deep breaths, feeling the strength in your legs and core.
On an exhale, slowly bend your knees, place your feet back on the floor, and return to your starting position.

name: Boat Pose
benefits:
Strengthens the core and abdominal muscles.
Improves balance and stability.
Relieves lower back pain by strengthening core muscles.
Increases leg strength.
Enhances body awareness and control.
description:
Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat.
Place your hands behind your knees to help with balance.
On an inhale, lift your chest and engage your back muscles to straighten your spine.
Engage your lower abdomen, pulling it inward and upward to activate your core.
Lean back, balancing on your sitting bones.
Lift your feet until your shins are parallel to the floor, keeping your knees bent.
Extend your arms forward, parallel to the floor, in line with your body.
Hold the pose for a few deep breaths, feeling the activation in your core and the stretch in your legs.
On an exhale, slowly lower your feet back to the floor and return to your starting position.

name: Half Boat Pose
benefits:
Enhances core strength and hip flexors.
Stimulates abdominal organs, including the kidneys, thyroid, prostate, and intestines.
Helps relieve stress through core engagement and controlled breathing.
Improves posture by strengthening the spine.
description:
Start sitting on your mat with your legs straight.
Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the floor, with your hands on your thighs. On an inhale, engage your core, and lean back slightly as you lift your feet, bringing your shins parallel to the floor and your knees at a 90-degree angle.
Slide your hands from your thighs to your calves or ankles and pull your legs closer to your abdomen. Keep your back straight, avoiding any rounding or arching, and lengthen your spine. Ground your tailbone and sitting bones, feeling your core activate.
Hold the pose for 3-5 breaths, focusing on your breathing and maintaining balance. On each inhale, lengthen your spine; on each exhale, tighten your abdomen.
On an inhale, slowly lower your legs back to the floor and return your hands to your sides, returning to your starting position.

name: Bound Angle Pose
benefits:
Stretches and strengthens the thighs, core, and back.
Improves overall blood circulation.
Relieves menstrual discomfort and irregularities.
Eases discomfort from sciatica.
Reduces anxiety and emotional stress.
description:
Sit on the floor with your sitting bones firmly grounded and your body upright.
Bend your knees, bring the soles of your feet together, and hold your feet with your hands.
Press your fingertips into the floor to help stabilize your body.
Keep your spine long and straight.
Gently spread your toes to relax your feet.
Internally rotate your thighs to bring your knees closer to the floor.
If you can, fold forward from your hips while keeping your back long.
Hold the pose for a few deep breaths, feeling the stretch in your hips and groin.
On an exhale, slowly sit back up, lift your knees, straighten your legs, and return to a seated position.

name: Bound Inverted Tortoise Pose
benefits:
Increases spinal flexibility through twisting and stretching.
Stretches the back and hamstrings, relieving muscle tension.
Promotes digestion by compressing the abdomen.
Increases blood circulation to the brain due to the inversion.
Relieves stress through deep stretching and relaxation.
description:
Start in Plow Pose. Lie on your back with your legs straight up and your feet pointing toward the floor behind your head. Your hands are at your sides.
On an exhale, slowly lower your knees to your sides until they touch the floor.
Clasp your hands behind your back, extending your arms as much as possible while keeping your shoulders relaxed.
Ensure your back and neck are comfortable, avoiding excessive compression. You can place your hands under your hips to reduce neck pressure if needed.
Hold the pose with deep breaths, feeling the stretch in your spine and back.
On an inhale, release your hands and straighten your legs. On an exhale, slowly roll your body back to the floor and relax.

name: Bow Pose
benefits:
Strengthens the back, hamstrings, and abdominal muscles.
Increases flexibility in the back, spine, and hip flexors.
Improves posture by opening the chest and shoulders.
Promotes digestion by massaging and toning the digestive organs.
Helps relieve stress and fatigue.
Eases menstrual discomfort.
description:
Start by lying face down on the floor with your arms at your sides.
Bend your knees, bringing your feet toward your hips, with your heels as close as possible.
Reach your arms back and grab your feet, ankles, or pants (use a yoga strap if you can't reach).
Pull your shoulders back, avoiding shrugging.
On an inhale, lift your knees off the floor, simultaneously raising your chest and head, and maintain your balance.
Hold the pose for at least 15 seconds, or for 5 to 10 deep breaths.
On an exhale, slowly lower your body back to the floor and return to a prone position.

name: Big Toe Bow I
benefits:
Opens the chest and shoulders, relieving tension from prolonged sitting.
Enhances spinal strength through the backbend.
Stretches the hips and front of the thighs.
Boosts energy and relieves fatigue.
description:
Start by lying face down with your legs straight and your hands at your sides, palms down.
Bend your knees and bring your heels as close as possible to your hips. Reach back with your hands and grasp the ankle or top of your foot on the same side.
With your hands holding your ankles, externally rotate your elbows so your fingers point back and your elbows point up. Slowly lift your chest and thighs off the floor, maintaining a long, strong spine.
Hold the pose for 3-5 breaths, focusing on lengthening your spine and feeling the power. Gaze forward or up at the ceiling, keeping your neck in a neutral extension.
On an inhale, slowly release by first lowering your chest, then your thighs to the floor. Straighten your legs and return your hands to your sides, resting for a moment.

name: Thread the Needle Pose
benefits:
Effectively stretches the hips and thighs.
Relieves neck and shoulder discomfort through twisting and stretching.
Increases spinal flexibility and eases back stiffness.
Helps relieve stress and relax the mind and body.
description:
Begin in Tabletop Pose, with your wrists aligned under your shoulders and your knees under your hips.
On an inhale, extend your right arm up, palm facing forward. On an exhale, thread your right arm under your left armpit, bringing your outer right shoulder to the floor. Extend your left hand forward, palm down, and rest your left cheek on the floor.
Keep your hips stable, avoiding any twisting. You can extend your right hand forward, palm up, to feel a stretch in your shoulder and side waist.
Hold the pose for 3-5 breaths, focusing on releasing tension with each exhale.
On an inhale, slowly return to Tabletop Pose. Repeat on the other side.

name: Bridge Pose
benefits:
Strengthens the back, glutes, and legs, and enhances core strength to improve posture and prevent back pain.
Stretches the chest, neck, and spine, improving breathing and circulation.
Stimulates abdominal organs to aid digestion.
Relieves stress and anxiety by relaxing the body and mind.
Improves balance and stability with regular practice.
description:
Lie on your back with your knees bent, feet hip-width apart, and toes pointing forward. Place your arms at your sides with your palms down.
On an inhale, use your heels and shoulders to support your body as you lift your hips off the floor, forming a straight line.
Hold the pose, feeling the engagement in your back, glutes, and legs. You can interlace your hands beneath your back or keep your arms at your sides.
On an exhale, slowly lower your hips back to the floor and relax.
Repeat the practice several times, holding the pose for 15-30 seconds each time.

name: Camel Pose
benefits:
Helps expand the chest and increases back flexibility.
Builds spinal strength and stability.
Massages abdominal organs to promote digestive function.
Engages the core and back muscles to tone the body.
Eases tension in the lower back.
Helps improve posture and prevent a rounded back.
description:
Start in a kneeling position on your mat with your knees directly under your hips.
On an inhale, lengthen your spine upward.
Slowly reach your hands back to grasp your heels.
On an exhale, drop your head back while keeping your neck long.
Hold the pose for 5-10 deep breaths.
On an inhale, slowly return to your starting kneeling position.

name: Cat Pose
benefits:
Stretches and flexes the spine to ease pressure.
Helps awaken the body and boost overall vitality.
Engages abdominal muscles to build strength.
Stretches the spine to help improve overall posture and reduce slouching.
Massages abdominal organs to aid digestive function.
description:
Begin in Tabletop Pose, with your wrists, elbows, and shoulders aligned in a straight line and your knees directly under your hips.
Shift your weight forward onto your hands.
Engage your abdomen, pulling it in and up to round your spine into a strong arch.
Lower your head, bringing the crown of your head toward the floor and relaxing your neck.
Focus your gaze between your arms, looking toward your abdomen.
Hold the pose for 5-10 deep breaths, feeling the stretch in your spine and the contraction in your abdomen.
On an exhale, slowly return to Tabletop Pose.

name: Caterpillar Pose
benefits:
Stretches ligaments around the spine to increase flexibility.
Builds hamstring strength and flexibility.
Compresses the abdomen to aid digestion and relieve constipation.
description:
Sit on a folded blanket or mat with your legs extended in front of you.
Fold forward from your hips, rounding your back.
Let your head hang down naturally, bringing it as close to your knees as possible.
Place your hands on your thighs, on the floor, or on your toes, adjusting based on your flexibility.
Hold the pose for 3-5 minutes, breathing deeply and feeling the stretch in your back and legs.
On an exhale, slowly roll your body back up to a seated position.

name: Chair Pose
benefits:
Strengthens ankles, thighs, calves, and spine, builds lower body and spinal strength.
Helps open the shoulders and chest to improve posture.
Stimulates abdominal organs, diaphragm, and heart, promotes digestion and circulation.
Strengthens ankle and leg muscles to improve foot structure.
Activates full body energy, boosts overall vitality and stability.
description:
Stand with your feet together and your toes actively lifted.
Bend your knees, shifting your weight back onto your heels to keep them stable.
Slightly tuck your pelvis to avoid over-tilting.
Lift your ribs and open your chest.
Keep your neck long and in line with your spine.
Raise your arms overhead toward the ceiling, keeping your elbows straight and your biceps next to your ears.
Keep your palms together or shoulder-width apart, with fingers spread.
Hold the pose for 5-10 deep breaths, feeling your legs and core engage.
On an exhale, slowly return to a standing position and relax your arms.

name: Revolved Chair Pose
benefits:
Deeply stretches the lower back to relieve tension.
Improves the mobility of the spine through the twisting action.
Effectively stretches the shoulders to relieve stiffness.
Develops your sense of balance and coordination.
The twisting motion stimulates the abdominal organs to aid digestion.
description:
Begin in Mountain Pose with your feet together and your hands at your sides.
On an inhale, reach your hands overhead. On an exhale, bend your knees and sit back as if you are in a chair, keeping your back straight. Keep your feet flat on the floor and your knees behind your toes.
From Chair Pose, on an inhale, bring your hands to a prayer position at your chest. On an exhale, twist your body to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee and extending your right arm up with your palm out.
Ensure your left elbow is snug against your right knee and reach your right arm high to deepen the spinal twist. Open your left shoulder back and your right shoulder forward, keeping your chest open. Keep your hips square and avoid one hip lifting higher than the other.
Hold the pose for 3-5 breaths, focusing on the stretch and twist in your spine. Look at your right fingertips or at the floor, adjusting for neck comfort.
On an inhale, slowly untwist back to the center and return your hands to your sides. Repeat on the other side.

name: Child’s Pose
benefits:
Increases flexibility in the hips, back, ankles, and feet.
Helps stretch and lengthen the spine to relieve back tension.
Eases tension and stress in the neck.
Reduces injury risk through relaxation and stretching.
A restorative pose that helps relax the body and mind and restore energy.
description:
Kneel on the floor with your feet together and shins flat on the ground.
Spread your knees hip-width or wider, and sit back on your heels.
Fold your body forward, resting your abdomen on your thighs.
Place your forehead on the floor and relax your facial muscles.
Extend your arms forward with palms facing down.
Relax your neck and your entire body, releasing any tension.
Take slow, deep breaths, feeling your body relax.
Hold the pose for 1-3 minutes or as long as you need to rest.

name: Chin Stand
benefits:
Strengthens the back, hips, pelvis, and legs.
Improves balance and back flexibility.
Stretches and strengthens back muscles to correct poor posture.
Activates the Root (Muladhara), Sacral (Swadhisthana), and Throat (Vishuddha) Chakras to enhance energy flow.
Increases blood supply to the brain to improve cognitive function.
Relieves Stress: Like other inversions, Chin Stand can alleviate stress and anxiety.
description:
Start in Tabletop Pose, with your hands and knees on the floor.
Lift one leg toward the sky, keeping the toes of the other leg curled for stability.
Bend your elbows to form a narrow, strong push-up position.
Lower your chin, front of your shoulders, and chest gently to the ground. As you do, straighten your bottom leg to lift your hips higher.
Lift both legs together with a small hop from your bottom leg, squeezing your inner thighs together.
Maintain a slight arch in your back, avoiding overextension.
Hold the pose for 5-10 deep breaths, or as long as you feel comfortable.
On an exhale, slowly release your body back to the starting position and relax.

name: Half Cobra Pose
benefits:
Gently stretches the spine and strengthens back muscles.
Releases tension in the neck, shoulders, and back through a gentle backbend.
Stimulates abdominal organs to aid digestion and relieve bloating.
Helps alleviate pressure on spinal discs.
description:
Lie on your stomach with your legs together, the tops of your feet on the floor, and your toes pointing straight back. Place your hands at your sides, palms down, with your forehead or chin lightly on the floor.
Bend your elbows and place your palms next to your shoulders, with your fingertips pointing forward and your forearms perpendicular to the floor. Keep your feet, shins, and thighs firmly on the ground, pressing your pubic bone down and slightly engaging your glutes.
On an inhale, use the strength of your hands and forearms to slowly lift your upper body, keeping your elbows bent. As you lift, keep your pubic bone and legs glued to the floor, avoiding strain in your lower back.
Open your chest upward and squeeze your shoulder blades back and down, avoiding shrugging. Tuck your tailbone down and slightly inward, feeling a lengthening in your spine. Look straight ahead or down, avoiding overextending your neck.
Hold the pose for 3-5 breaths, feeling the spinal extension and back muscle activation.
On an exhale, slowly bend your elbows and lower your upper body back to the floor, returning to your starting position.

name: Cobra Pose
benefits:
Enhances the mobility of the spine through stretching and flexing.
Helps open the chest and stretch the abdominal muscles, relieving tension.
Builds strength in the spine and shoulders for overall stability.
Stretches and strengthens back muscles to correct poor posture and reduce slouching.
Massages abdominal organs to aid digestive function.
description:
Lie face down on the floor with your legs straight and hip-width apart, and the tops of your feet on the floor.
Spread your fingers and place your hands directly under your shoulders, with your fingers pointing to the top of the mat.
Keep your elbows tucked in at your sides.
Pressing your feet into the floor, lift your head and chest off the ground.
Keep your lower ribs on the floor, avoiding an excessive backbend.
Roll your shoulders back and down to open your chest and move them away from your ears. Keep your neck long and relaxed.
Slowly straighten your arms to lift your chest higher, while keeping your abdomen and pelvis connected to the floor.
Press the tops of your thighs down for added stability and strength.
Hold the pose for 5-10 deep breaths, feeling the spinal extension and back activation.
On an exhale, slowly lower your body back to the floor and relax.

name: Corpse Pose
benefits:
Helps relieve stress and mild depression, and soothes the nervous system.
Provides deep relaxation for the entire body, relieving muscle tension.
Deep relaxation helps improves sleep quality.
Helps reduce blood pressure and promotes cardiovascular health.
Helps the body restore energy and reduces fatigue after practice.
description:
Lie on your back on the floor with your legs naturally spread, hip-width apart or wider, and your arms at your sides.
Turn your palms up, relax your hands, and let your fingers curl naturally.
Roll your shoulder blades back and down onto the floor, ensuring your shoulders are comfortably grounded.
Straighten your legs, allowing your heels to turn in and your toes to splay out naturally.
Close your eyes and relax your facial muscles, including your eyebrows, eye sockets, and jaw.
Relax every part of your body, from head to toe, feeling your weight sink into the floor.
Hold the pose for 5-15 minutes of deep relaxation, focusing on your breath and inner peace.
When finished, slowly wiggle your fingers and toes, then gently roll onto your side before using your hands to support yourself as you slowly rise to a seated position.

name: Couch Pose
benefits:
Stretches the Feet, Quadriceps, and Psoas: Helps relieve leg tension and increases flexibility.
Stretches the Diaphragm and Abdominal Organs: Promotes easier breathing and relieves abdominal tension.
Opens the Lungs and Chest: Helps improve respiration and lung function.
Promotes Thyroid and Parathyroid Health: The stretch in the front of the neck enhances the function of these glands.
Supports Lymphatic Drainage: Helps lymph flow from the abdomen to the chest, supporting drainage under the collarbones.
Benefits the Vocal Cords: The stretch in the front of the neck relieves tension in the vocal cords.
description:
Lie flat on your back on your mat with your legs straight and your arms at your sides.
Bend your right knee, folding your right leg back and to the side of your right hip.
Bend your left leg in the same way. Once both legs are folded, try to keep your knees together, ensuring your head, neck, and the rest of your body stay aligned.
Extend your arms and elbows back behind you. Bend your elbows to fold your arms if necessary.
Breathe normally, feeling the stretch in your thighs, knees, and ankles.
Slowly straighten your legs to return to a supine position.

name: Cow Pose
benefits:
Relieves Fatigue: Reduces body fatigue through stretching and relaxation.
Improves Breathing and Circulation: Promotes blood flow to the brain and enhances breathing efficiency.
Boosts Body Vitality: Helps revitalize the whole body and improves overall health.
Eases Back, Neck, and Shoulder Pain: Relieves tension in these areas by stretching the spine and shoulders.
Improves Digestion: Helps keep abdominal muscles strong and promotes digestion.
Relieves Stress and Anxiety: Reduces mental stress through deep breathing and stretching.
description:
Start in Tabletop Pose, with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips.
On an inhale, tuck your navel inward, arch your back, lift your tailbone up, and look toward the ceiling.
Hold Cow Pose for a few seconds, feeling the stretch and flexibility in your spine.
On an exhale, slowly return to Tabletop Pose, relaxing your spine.
Repeat the process, feeling the stretch and flexibility in your spine as you coordinate with your breath.

name: Cow Face Pose
benefits:
Stretches the Ankles, Hips, and Thighs: Increases lower body flexibility through the crossed-leg position.
Stretches the Shoulders, Armpits, Triceps, and Chest: The twisting and crossing of the arms effectively stretches the upper body and shoulders.
Enhances Flexibility and Coordination: Improves overall body coordination through the complex movements.
Promotes Symmetry and Balance: Requires and helps improve symmetry and stability during the practice.
Aids Digestion and Detoxification: The seated position stimulates abdominal organs, promoting a healthy digestive system.
description:
From a seated position, extend your legs straight in front of you.
Bend your right knee, placing your right foot next to your left hip. Then, bend your left knee, placing your left foot next to your right hip, trying to stack your knees.
Reach your right arm straight up, then bend your elbow to bring your palm to the center of your back.
Reach your left arm down and bend it up, trying to hook your hands together behind your back.
Keep your back straight, your shoulders relaxed, and your head looking straight ahead or slightly up.
Take 5-10 deep breaths, going deeper into the stretch with each breath.
Slowly release your hands and legs, returning to a seated position.
Repeat on the other side.

name: Rock the Baby
benefits:
Stretches and Strengthens Hamstrings, Glutes, and Pelvic Floor: Enhances body flexibility through leg stretching and twisting.
Improves Flexibility and Joint Range of Motion: Helps open the hip joints and increases the range of motion in the legs and hips.
Calms the Nervous System: Deep relaxation helps relieve stress and anxiety, and soothes the mind.
Promotes Steady Breathing: Conscious breathing helps stabilize the breath and improve respiratory efficiency.
description:
Sit on the floor with your legs straight and feet together.
On an inhale, bend one knee.
Wrap your hands around the bent knee and ankle, and gently twist the shin inward.
Shift your hips to one side, maintaining your balance.
Straighten your back and gently rock your hips back and forth, feeling the stretch.
Slowly release your leg back to the floor, returning to your starting seated position.
Repeat on the other side for a balanced practice.

name: Crane Pose
benefits:
Strengthens the Forearms, Wrists, Shoulders, Upper Back, and Abdominal Muscles: Builds core and upper body strength by supporting your body weight.
Improves Balance: Requires a good sense of balance, which helps enhance overall coordination.
Increases Focus: Requires concentration, which helps improve focus and mental stability.
Promotes Blood Circulation: The inversion helps increase blood flow to the head and upper body, relieving fatigue.
description:
Start in a squat with your feet together and your knees apart.
Place your hands on your mat with your fingers spread wide, creating a stable base with your palms and fingertips.
Lift your heels, balancing on your toes, and lift your hips high.
Keep your arms straight and bring your knees up as high as possible, resting them on the inside of your arms.
Engage your core to keep your body stable.
Keeping your arms straight, lean forward from your hips, shifting your weight forward.
When your weight is far enough forward, gently lift your feet off the ground, finding your balance. Pull your heels toward your sitting bones to maintain stability.
Keep your chin slightly lifted and gaze forward to help with balance.
Hold the pose for 5-10 deep breaths, feeling the stability and strength of your body.
On an exhale, slowly lower your feet back to the ground and return to a squatting position to relax.

name: Crooked Monkey
benefits:
Opens and Stretches the Hip Flexors, Quadriceps, and Thoracic Spine: Increases flexibility in these areas through twisting and stretching.
Strengthens the Arms: Builds arm strength through supporting and twisting.
Improves Balance: Requires a good sense of balance, which helps improve overall coordination.
Promotes Spinal Health: The twist enhances spinal flexibility and relieves back tension.
Enhances Core Stability: Engages the core muscles to improve overall stability.
description:
Begin in a low lunge with your hands inside your front foot and your knee bent.
Lower your back knee to the floor and stretch back, leaning forward slightly to open your hip flexors.
Rotate your front foot outward to about a 45-degree angle, with your toes pointing to the corner of the mat.
Engage your front foot and ankle, then let your front knee rotate outward.
Press your outer palm into the mat for stability.
Bend your back knee and reach back with your free hand to grasp your foot or ankle.
Rotate your shoulder outward, ensuring your weight is above your knee, not directly on it.
Allow your spine to twist, rotating your chest upward and widening your shoulder blades.
Hold the pose for 5-10 deep breaths, feeling the twist and stretch.
On an exhale, slowly release the pose and return to a low lunge or standing position.

name: Crow Pose
benefits:
Strengthens the Forearms, Wrists, Shoulders, Upper Back, and Abdominal Muscles: Builds core and upper body strength by supporting your body weight.
Improves Balance: Requires a good sense of balance, which helps enhance overall coordination.
Increases Focus: Requires concentration, which helps improve focus and mental stability.
Promotes Blood Circulation: The inversion helps increase blood flow to the head and upper body, relieving fatigue.
Builds Confidence: Successfully performing this pose can boost a practitioner's confidence.
description:
Begin in a squat with your feet together and your knees apart.
Spread your fingers wide on the mat, pressing your palms and fingertips down for a stable base.
Lift your heels, balancing on your toes, and raise your hips high.
Shift your body weight slightly forward, bending your elbows and placing your knees onto the back of your triceps.
Continue to shift your weight forward until your toes gently lift off the ground, with your full body weight resting on your arms.
Keep your chin lifted and gaze slightly forward and down to help with balance.
Hold the pose for 5-10 deep breaths, feeling your body's stability and strength.
On an exhale, slowly lower your feet back to the ground and return to a squatting position to relax.

name: Side Crow Pose
benefits:
Strengthens the Arms, Wrists, and Core Muscles.
Improves Balance and Coordination.
Increases Flexibility in the Spine, Shoulders, and Hips.
Relieves Stress through the twisting action and release of bodily tension.
description:
Start in Chair Pose with your feet hip-width apart and your hands in a prayer position at your chest.
On an exhale, twist your torso to the left, bringing your right elbow to the outside of your left knee while keeping your hands in prayer position.
Release your hands and place them flat on the floor outside your left foot, squatting down with your feet on the ground.
Keep the twist as you press the back of your left arm into your right thigh, with your right thigh close to your left armpit. Bend your arms, tucking your elbows towards your chest, similar to a Chaturanga, and spread your fingers wide.
On an inhale, shift your weight forward and slide your left leg to the right, stacking your knees. Slowly lift your right foot and left leg off the ground, crossing your legs and finding your balance.
Hold the pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute, feeling your core engage and your body twist. Keep your breathing steady and avoid holding your breath.
On an exhale, slowly lower your feet to the floor and return to a squat. Repeat on the other side.

name: Dancer Pose
benefits:
伸展身体：拉伸肩膀、胸部、大腿、腹股沟和腹部。
增强力量：强化腿部和脚踝的力量。
改善平衡：提升身体的平衡感和协调能力。
提升柔韧性：增加脊柱、髋部和肩部的灵活性。
舒缓压力：通过打开胸腔，释放紧张情绪，舒缓压力。
description:
起始姿势：从站立姿势开始，双脚并拢，双手放在身体两侧。
抬起脚跟：将重心转移到一侧腿上，抬起另一侧脚的脚跟，使膝盖弯曲，脚跟向臀部靠拢。
抓住脚踝：用同侧手向后抓住抬起脚的外侧脚踝或脚背。注意保持身体平衡。
抬起腿部：借助手的力量，将弯曲的腿向上抬起，同时将身体重心向前移动，使抬起腿的膝关节尽量伸展，大腿尽量与地面平行。
伸展手臂：另一只手臂向前上方伸展，与身体形成一条直线，保持手臂伸直。
调整视线：眼睛看向正前方，保持颈部和脊柱的延长。
核心稳定：避免腰部过度压缩，通过将耻骨向肚脐方向提拉，同时将尾骨向下压，保持脊柱的中立位。
保持呼吸：保持3-5个呼吸，感受身体的伸展和平衡。
换边练习：慢慢回到起始姿势，换另一侧练习。

name: Dancer Pose
benefits:
Stretches the Body: Stretches the shoulders, chest, thighs, groin, and abdomen.
Enhances Strength: Strengthens the legs and ankles.
Improves Balance: Enhances your sense of balance and coordination.
Increases Flexibility: Improves the flexibility of the spine, hips, and shoulders.
Relieves Stress: Opens the chest to release tension and relieve stress.
description:
Start in a standing position with your feet together and your arms at your sides.
Shift your weight onto one leg, and lift the heel of the other foot, bending the knee to bring the heel toward your glute.
Reach back with the same-side hand to grasp the outside of your lifted foot or ankle. Maintain your balance.
Using your hand, lift your bent leg up, simultaneously shifting your body weight forward. Straighten your lifted leg as much as possible, aiming to make your thigh parallel to the floor.
Extend your other arm forward and upward, creating a straight line with your body and keeping your arm straight.
Look straight ahead, maintaining a long neck and spine.
Avoid over-compressing your lower back by lifting your pubic bone towards your navel and tucking your tailbone down, keeping your spine neutral.
Hold for 3-5 breaths, feeling the stretch and balance.
Slowly return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

name: King Dancer Pose
benefits:
Stretches the Body: Stretches the shoulders, chest, thighs, groin, and abdomen.
Enhances Strength: Strengthens the legs and ankles.
Improves Balance: Enhances your sense of balance and coordination.
Boosts Cardiopulmonary Function: Opens the chest and heart chakra to improve breathing and circulation.
Increases Flexibility: Improves the flexibility of the spine and hips.
description:
Start in Mountain Pose with your arms at your sides.
Bend one knee backward and grab your ankle or the top of your foot with the same-side hand. Rotate your elbow inward and upward as you extend your leg back and up from the hip.
Extend your other arm upward and bend the elbow to reach back and grasp your ankle or foot. Keep your head lifted, looking straight ahead or upward.
Engage your core to stabilize your body. Keep your standing leg straight and strong, but avoid hyperextending (locking) the knee.
Keep your pelvis level to create a symmetrical foundation for a full spinal extension.
Press your tailbone down and open your chest upward, pushing the lower tips of your shoulder blades forward and up to help open the heart chakra.
Advanced option: If you feel stable and comfortable, bring the crown of your head closer to the arch of your foot and bring your elbows closer together.
Breathe naturally, feeling the stretch and balance in your body.
Slowly return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

name: Ear Pressure Pose
benefits:
Promotes Full-Body Circulation: Increases blood flow to the head and upper body through the inversion.
Activates Energy Centers: Stimulates the Throat (Vishuddha) and Solar Plexus (Manipura) Chakras to enhance energy flow.
Relieves Stress and Anxiety: Helps reduce stress, soothes the nervous system, and alleviates anxiety.
Builds Muscle Strength: Strengthens the muscles of the legs, back, arms, and abdomen.
Improves Thyroid Function: Stimulates the thyroid gland, which helps regulate the menstrual cycle.
Increases Body Flexibility: Improves the flexibility of the spine and legs.
description:
Start by lying flat on your back, with your legs together and your arms at your sides.
Raise your legs over your head, bringing your knees as close to your ears as possible and placing your feet firmly on the ground.
Extend your arms back, interlace your fingers, and place your palms face down on the floor.
Keep your neck flat on the floor, avoiding any strain.
Close your eyes to focus on your internal state and enter a state of deep relaxation.
Hold the pose for 3 deep breaths. You can hold for a few seconds to a few minutes, depending on your ability.
On an exhale, slowly lower your legs back to the floor and return to a supine position.

name: Dolphin Pose
benefits:
Calms the Brain: Helps relieve stress and mild depression, and soothes the nervous system.
Activates Body Energy: Boosts overall vitality and a sense of liveliness.
Stretches Multiple Body Parts: Stretches the shoulders, hamstrings, calves, arches, and hands.
Strengthens the Arms and Legs: Builds core and limb strength by supporting your body weight.
description:
Start in Downward-Facing Dog Pose, with your hands and feet supporting your body to form an inverted 'V' shape.
Lower your forearms to the floor, keeping your elbows close to your body and your palms facing down.
Slightly tuck your pelvis to avoid over-arching your back.
Lift your chest, maintaining a long spine.
Ground your heels and straighten your legs, keeping your tailbone lifted high (similar to the 'dog tail' in Downward-Facing Dog).
Gaze downward and slightly forward, keeping your neck long.
Hold the pose for 5-10 deep breaths, feeling the stretch and strength in your body.
On an exhale, slowly return to Downward-Facing Dog or a seated position to relax.

name: Downward-Facing Dog
benefits:
Strengthens Core Muscles, Ankles, Hamstrings, and Calves: Builds strength in these areas by supporting your body weight.
Lengthens and Relaxes the Upper Body: Stretches the shoulders, back, and arms, relieving tension in the upper body.
Opens the Chest, Back, Tailbone, and Shoulders: Helps improve posture and increases body flexibility.
Promotes Blood Circulation: The inversion helps increase blood flow to the head, relieving fatigue.
Relieves Stress and Anxiety: Deep breathing and stretching help calm the mind.
description:
Start in Tabletop Pose with your hands and knees on the floor, your hands directly under your shoulders, and your knees directly under your hips.
Shift your hands forward slightly.
Curl your toes under.
On an inhale, lift your hips and knees off the ground, forming an inverted 'V' shape with your body.
Straighten your legs as much as you can without straining. Your heels do not need to touch the floor.
Lengthen your spine upward, avoiding a sagging lower back, and maintain a stable body.
Roll your shoulder blades back and down, away from your ears, to avoid shrugging.
Rotate your inner thighs back to help stabilize your pelvis.
Hold the pose for 5-10 deep breaths, feeling the stretch and strength in your body.
On an exhale, slowly return to Tabletop or a seated position to relax.

name: Revolved Downward-Facing Dog
benefits:
Relieves Stress: The twisting motion stimulates abdominal organs, relieving stress and mild depression.
Enhances Flexibility: Stretches the spine, shoulders, neck, and hamstrings, improving body flexibility.
Builds Strength: Strengthens the arms and legs, enhancing body stability.
Improves Digestion: The twist stimulates abdominal organs, promoting digestion and relieving constipation.
Relieves Back Pain: Stretches the spine to alleviate back tension and pain.
description:
Start in a classic Downward-Facing Dog Pose with your hands shoulder-width apart, your feet hip-width apart, and your body in an inverted 'V' shape. Ensure your hands and heels are evenly grounded and your spine is long.
On an inhale, open your right knee to the side and twist your right elbow towards your left knee, lightly resting your right elbow on the outside of your left knee. You can keep your left hand on the floor or lift your left arm with your hands in prayer to deepen the twist.
Keep your spine long and your chest open, reaching it toward the ceiling. Engage your core to maintain stability and avoid your lower back from sagging. Relax your neck and gaze at your left fingertips or straight ahead.
Hold the pose for 3-5 breaths, feeling the spinal twist and body stretch.
On an inhale, slowly untwist and return to a classic Downward-Facing Dog. Repeat on the other side.

name: Dragonfly Pose
benefits:
Improves Balance and Focus: Enhances body coordination and stability by supporting your body weight on your arms.
Strengthens Limbs and Back: Builds strength in the legs, shoulders, arms, and back.
Opens the Hips: Increases hip joint flexibility through twisting and stretching.
Tones Abdominal Muscles: Activates and strengthens the core to help maintain balance.
description:
Start in a standing position.
Cross your right ankle over your left thigh and open your right leg outward.
Squat and twist: Twist your torso to the left and touch your fingertips to the ground for stability.
Adjust your arms and foot: Move your right arm back so that the tricep (back of your upper arm) rests on the inside of your right foot.
Place your hands flat on the ground with your fingers spread wide, ensuring your wrists are stable.
Shift your weight forward: Shift your body weight forward, lifting your left toes off the ground and transferring your weight to your hands.
Lift your left leg: On an inhale, lift your left leg up and straighten it as much as possible, maintaining your balance.
Hold the pose, breathing deeply, and feeling your body's balance and strength.
On an exhale, carefully lower your left leg and return to the starting position. Repeat on the other side.

name: Himalayan Duck
benefits:
Strengthens the Core, Arms, and Shoulders: Builds strength in these areas by supporting your body weight.
Improves Hip, Knee, and Ankle Flexibility: Helps open the hips and increases the range of motion in the knees and ankles.
Enhances Balance: Requires a good sense of balance, which helps improve overall coordination.
Promotes Blood Circulation: The inversion helps increase blood flow to the head and upper body, relieving fatigue.
description:
Start in Full Lotus Pose with your legs crossed and your feet on the opposite thighs.
Shift your body weight forward onto your knees, maintaining stability.
Place your forearms on the floor, shoulder-width apart, with your fingers spread and palms down.
Engage your core to stabilize your body.
Press into your forearms to lift your body, placing your weight on your forearms and knees.
Lift your knees upward, bringing them as close to the back of your arms as possible.
Arch your upper back and push your spine upward, maintaining stability and length in your body.
Hold the pose for 5-10 deep breaths, feeling the stretch and strength.
On an exhale, slowly lower your body back to the floor, returning to Lotus or a seated position to relax.

name: Eagle Pose
benefits:
Improves Balance and Focus: Requires concentration and body coordination to enhance balance and focus.
Opens the Hips and Chest: Increases flexibility in the hips and chest through twisting and stretching.
Relieves Neck and Shoulder Tension: Helps relax neck and shoulder muscles to ease tension.
Strengthens the Legs: Builds muscle strength in the legs through single-leg support.
Promotes Blood Circulation: The twisting motion helps improve full-body circulation and relieve fatigue.
description:
Start in a standing position with your feet together.
Lift one leg, bending the knee and placing the lifted knee over the other leg.
Wrap the foot of the lifted leg behind the calf of the standing leg.
Cross your arms at the elbows, creating an 'X' shape in front of your chest.
Bring your palms together as much as possible, keeping your arms stable.
Lift your elbows to shoulder level, keeping your arms extended.
Move your forearms forward, maintaining a stable and extended arm position.
Tuck your tailbone down to keep your spine long.
Look straight ahead or slightly upward, keeping your neck long.
Hold the pose for 5-10 deep breaths, feeling your body's balance and stretch.
On an exhale, slowly unwrap your arms and legs, return to a standing position, and repeat on the other side.

name: Easy Pose
benefits:
Opens the Hips: Helps increase hip flexibility.
Stretches the Knees and Ankles: Relieves tension in the knees and ankles.
Strengthens the Back: Enhances back muscles by maintaining a straight spine.
Calms the Brain: Helps calm the mind, relieving stress and anxiety.
Promotes Blood Circulation: Improves circulation in the pelvic area.
Enhances Focus: The stable seated position enhances focus, making it suitable for meditation.
description:
Start by sitting on a yoga mat with your legs extended in front of you.
Cross your legs, bending your knees and placing your feet under the opposite thighs. Ensure your knees are lower than your hips for a comfortable seat.
Place your hands on your thighs or knees, keeping your palms relaxed.
Sit up straight, maintaining the natural curve of your spine and avoiding slouching.
Roll your shoulders back and down, away from your ears, and keep them relaxed.
Keep your head straight, looking forward or slightly downward, maintaining a long neck.
Hold the pose for 5-10 deep breaths, feeling your body relax and stabilize.
On an exhale, slowly uncross your legs and return to a comfortable seated or supine position.

name: Seated Twist
benefits:
Stretches the Back and Spine: Relieves back tension and increases spinal flexibility.
Promotes Digestion: Stimulates abdominal organs through the twisting action to improve digestive function.
Relieves Stress: Helps relax the body and mind, and alleviates mild depression.
Strengthens the Core: Activates abdominal muscles to enhance core stability.
description:
Start in Easy Pose with your legs crossed, feet flat on the floor, and your spine straight.
On an inhale, place your left hand on the floor behind you for support. On an exhale, place your right hand on the outside of your left knee, preparing to twist.
Begin the twist from your abdomen, turning to the left and feeling the stretch and twist in your spine. Press your left hand into the floor and your right hand gently on your left knee to help deepen the twist.
Keep your spine long and avoid slouching or arching your back, ensuring the twist comes from your spine, not your neck. Relax your shoulders and keep your neck long.
Hold the pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute, feeling the stretch and twist in your spine. Focus on your breath, and try to deepen the twist with each exhale.
On an inhale, slowly untwist your body and bring your hands back to your sides. Repeat on the other side.

name: Eight Angle Pose
benefits:
Strengthens the Arms, Shoulders, and Core Muscles: Builds strength in the upper body and core by supporting your body weight.
Improves Digestion: The twisting motion massages abdominal organs to promote digestive function.
Enhances Balance and Stability: Requires a good sense of balance, which helps improve overall coordination.
Tones the Entire Body: The complex limb position helps tone muscles throughout the body.
Strengthens the Mind-Body Connection: Helps build the connection between the brain and muscles, enhancing focus and body awareness.
description:
Start in a squat with your feet together and your hands on either side of your feet. Place one arm between your legs and the other outside your feet.
Press into your hands, shifting your weight forward to lift your feet off the ground.
Bend one leg and rest it on your forearm.
Cross your other leg over the first at the ankle, creating a cross-legged position.
Straighten both legs, maintaining your balance and stability.
Hold the pose for 5-10 deep breaths, feeling your body's strength and balance.
On an exhale, slowly lower your body back to the ground and return to a squatting or seated position to relax.

name: Eight Limbed Pose
benefits:
Stretches the Neck and Shoulders: Relieves tension in the neck and shoulders.
Lengthens the Spine: Helps realign the spine and increases spinal flexibility.
Strengthens the Arms and Upper Body: Builds arm and upper body strength by supporting your body weight.
description:
Start in Tabletop Pose with your hands and knees on the floor, keeping your spine neutral.
Shift your shoulders and chest forward over your fingertips, and slowly lower your chest and chin to the ground.
Keep your elbows tucked close to your body and your tailbone lifted toward the ceiling.
Press down through your palms and fingertips to keep your shoulders lifted while relaxing the muscles between your shoulder blades.
Hold the pose for 2-4 breaths or adjust as needed.
On an inhale, return to Downward-Facing Dog; on an exhale, you can move into Plank Pose or slide your body into a prone position.

name: Elephant Trunk
benefits:
Improves Balance: Enhances body coordination and stability.
Stretches the Hips: Helps open the hip joints, relieving stiffness from prolonged sitting.
Strengthens the Core, Arms, and Legs: Builds strength in these areas by supporting your body weight.
Stimulates the Pelvic and Abdominal Regions: Promotes blood circulation in these areas.
description:
Start in Rock the Baby pose, cradling your knee and ankle in the crook of your elbows. Keep your knee lifted and slide your foot forward, threading the arm closest to your knee through your leg to create an 'elephant trunk' structure.
Lift your leg as high as possible, bringing it close to your shoulder. Place your hands flat on the floor, shoulder-width apart, and sit up straight.
Engage your core, straighten your arms, and lean your chest forward to create leverage. Press into your palms and straighten your arms further to lift your body off the ground.
Hold the pose for several breaths (5-10 deep breaths), feeling your body's balance and strength.
Slowly release the pose and repeat on the other side.

name: Embryo Pose
benefits:
Increases Flexibility: Improves the flexibility of the hips, knees, and ankles.
Strengthens the Spine and Back Muscles: Builds strength in the spine and back through the inversion.
Improves Balance: Develops your sense of balance while supported by the shoulders and neck.
Provides Deep Relaxation: Mimics a fetal position to help you enter a state of deep relaxation and relieve stress.
Promotes Introspection: Suitable for meditation or rest, helping you focus inward and connect with your inner world.
description:
Start in Supported Shoulderstand. Invert your body, with your legs straight up, and your hands supporting your back, keeping your neck and shoulders stable.
Move into Lotus Legs: Without lowering your hips, bend your legs into an 'aerial lotus' position. Use your hands to adjust your legs if needed.
Keep your neck broad and your base of support solid to avoid neck strain.
Slowly bring your lotus legs closer to your chest, supported by your shoulders and neck.
Wrap your arms around your legs and clasp your hands in front of your body.
Slowly lower your knees to either side of your head, curling your body into an embryo shape.
Hold the pose for 5-10 breaths, feeling your body's relaxation and balance.
Slowly release your hands, return to the 'aerial lotus' position, and carefully exit Shoulderstand to return to a supine position.

name: Embryo in Womb
benefits:
Strengthens the Core: Activates your core muscles by leaning forward and supporting your body with your arms.
Improves Hip, Knee, and Ankle Flexibility: The foundational Lotus Pose effectively stretches and relaxes these joints.
Promotes Mental and Physical Relaxation: Mimics a fetal position, bringing a sense of deep relaxation and security.
description:
Start in Full Lotus Pose with your legs crossed and each foot resting on the opposite thigh.
Move your hips back and thread your arms through the space between your thighs and shins.
Clasp your hands in front of your body, keeping your arms as close to your legs as possible and your elbows naturally bent.
Lean your torso forward, bringing your lotus legs close to your chest and maintaining your balance.
Hold the pose for 5-10 breaths, feeling your body's balance and core engagement.
Slowly ungrasp your hands, return to a seated Lotus Pose, then release the pose.

name: Equestrian Pose
benefits:
Stretches the Hips and Chest: Deeply stretches the hips and chest, relieving tension from prolonged sitting.
Strengthens the Legs: Builds leg muscle strength by bending the front knee and extending the back leg.
Improves Balance: Enhances your body's sense of balance and coordination.
Promotes Digestion: The forward and backward stretch of the torso massages abdominal organs, promoting digestion.
description:
Start in Mountain Pose with your feet together and your hands at your sides.
On an inhale, step your right foot forward and extend your left leg back, kneeling on your left knee with your toes tucked under. Bend your right knee to a 90-degree angle, ensuring your right knee is directly over your right ankle and not past your toes.
Square your hips forward to avoid twisting. Tuck your tailbone down and lift your ribs, keeping your spine long. Place your hands on either side of your right foot for balance.
Lift your head and look straight ahead or slightly upward, feeling your chest open and your hips stretch.
Hold the pose for 3-5 breaths, focusing on the stretch in your hips and chest.
On an exhale, bring your hands back to your sides and step your right foot back to Mountain Pose. Repeat on the other side.

name: Firefly
benefits:
Strengthens Arms and Wrists: Builds strength by supporting your body weight with your arms.
Improves Focus and Balance: Requires a high degree of concentration and balance.
Stretches the Lower Body: Lengthens the inner groins and hamstrings.
Strengthens the Core: Activates the abdominal muscles to enhance body stability.
description:
Start in a standing forward bend with your feet slightly wider than your hips and your hands on the ground or on blocks.
Bend your knees and lift your right heel, grabbing the back of your calf with both hands, pushing your leg forward. Tuck your shoulders inside your thighs, draping your legs over your upper arms like backpack straps.
Place your hands on the mat behind your heels with your fingertips pointing forward. Press into your fingertips, bend your knees, and lower your hips, looking forward.
Slowly shift the weight of your hips and legs onto your arms, until your legs are resting on your triceps like a seat.
Lift your feet, pressing your arms firmly. Hug your inner thighs tightly to your upper arms. Engage your core and find your balance.
Once balanced, straighten your legs, one at a time or together. Lift your chest and flex your feet.
To exit the pose, bend your knees and place your feet back on the ground, slowly lowering your hips.

name: Fire Log Pose
benefits:
Strengthens and Tones the Lower Body: Builds strength in the legs and hips.
Relieves Sedentary Lifestyle Effects: Helps counteract the negative effects of a sedentary lifestyle, especially stiffness in the hips and legs.
Builds Internal Heat and Stability: The deep hip stretch and activation help generate internal heat and enhance stability.
Balances Stability and Change: Finds balance in the body through deep stretching, promoting physical and mental stability and flexibility.
description:
Start in Easy Pose, seated on your mat.
Place your right ankle on top of your left knee, making your right shin parallel to your left thigh. Then, place your left ankle below your right knee, making your left shin parallel to your right thigh. Your legs should be 'stacked' like two logs.
Ensure your feet are as close to the ground as possible, keeping your ankles and knees stable. Keep your spine straight, shoulders relaxed, and hands resting on your thighs or knees.
Hold the pose with deep, steady breaths, feeling the stretch in your hips and the activation in your legs.
On an exhale, slowly unstack your legs and return to Easy Pose. Repeat on the other side (left leg on top, right leg on the bottom).

name: Fish Pose
benefits:
Opens the Chest and Lungs: Expands the chest, increasing lung capacity and improving breathing.
Improves Upper Body Posture: Helps correct a rounded back and improves an upright posture.
Stimulates the Thyroid: Stretches the neck to stimulate the thyroid gland and promote metabolism.
Stretches Abdominal Organs: Effectively stretches the abdominal area, relieving tension.
description:
Start by lying on your back with your legs together and your feet naturally turned out. Place your hands at your sides, palms down.
Slide your hands under your glutes, with your fingers pointing forward and palms facing down.
On an inhale, use the strength of your core and back to lift your chest and reach it toward the sky.
Shift your body weight onto your forearms, keeping your neck and shoulders relaxed.
Slowly drop your head back, letting the crown of your head lightly touch the ground. Be careful to protect your neck and avoid over-compression.
Hold the pose with steady breaths, feeling the opening in your chest and the lengthening of your spine. Hold for 5-10 breaths.
On an inhale, slowly lift your head, return to a supine position, and place your hands back at your sides, relaxing your entire body.

name: Humble Flamingo
benefits:
Strengthens Legs and Core: Single-leg balance activates leg muscles and requires core engagement.
Improves Balance and Stability: Enhances body coordination and balance through single-leg support.
Stretches Hips and Hamstrings: Helps relieve tension in the legs and back.
Enhances Focus: Requires a high degree of concentration and balance, which helps improve mental focus.
description:
Start in Pyramid Pose with your arms extended forward. Step one foot forward and the other back with your heel lifted. Place your hands on the floor on either side of your front foot.
Shift your hands back away from your front foot and rotate your fingertips backward, supporting your weight on your fingertips. Keep your arms straight and your body lengthened toward your front leg, with a straight spine.
Shift your weight onto your fingertips and the heel of your front foot, gently lifting the heel of your back foot. Bend your back knee, bringing your heel toward your glute.
Focus all your weight on the heel of your front foot and your fingertips to maintain your balance. Breathe steadily, feeling the strength in your legs and core.
Slowly lower your back foot, move your hands forward, and return to Pyramid Pose. Repeat on the other side.

name: Floating Stick
benefits:
Strengthens Upper Body: Builds strength in the arms, shoulders, and wrists by supporting your body weight.
Improves Balance: Requires a high degree of focus and balance, which helps enhance body coordination.
Strengthens Core Muscles: Activates the abdominal core to enhance core strength.
Stimulates Digestive Organs: The compression in the abdomen promotes a healthy digestive system.
description:
Start by sitting on your mat with your legs straight and together, and your feet flexed. Place your hands on the floor at your sides, palms down.
Slide your hands back, placing them on the floor beside your hips, with your fingers pointing forward. Your hands should be shoulder-width or slightly wider.
Slightly round your back and use the strength of your arms to lift your hips off the ground. Keep your arms straight, and your shoulders rolled back and down, away from your ears.
Slowly shift your hips backward, using your arms to find your center of gravity. Ensure your body is stable and not swaying.
Hold the pose with steady breaths, feeling the strength in your arms, shoulders, and core. Hold for 3-5 breaths, or as long as you can.
Slowly lower your hips back to the ground and relax your legs.

name: Flying Lizard
benefits:
Increases Hip Flexibility: Deeply stretches the hips, releasing tension in the hip joints and surrounding muscles.
Strengthens Legs: Works the front of the thighs and glutes.
Relieves Stiffness from Sitting: Helps alleviate hip and lower back stiffness from a sedentary lifestyle.
Enhances Flexibility: Stretches the inner thighs, hamstrings, and groin.
Relieves Stress and Anxiety: Deep stretching and conscious breathing help relax the body and mind.
description:
Start in Downward-Facing Dog, and step your right foot forward to the outside of your right hand, with your right knee directly over your right ankle.
Extend your left knee back and place the top of your left foot on the mat, gradually shifting your body weight onto your right leg.
Place your hands on the floor inside your right foot, parallel to it. You can use yoga blocks for support and stability. Keep your back straight, your spine long, and your gaze forward or downward.
To deepen the pose, you can open your front leg outward to further stretch the hips. Slowly lower your forearms to the floor, with your elbows directly under your shoulders and your forearms parallel. You can try lifting your back knee, straightening your leg, and balancing on your toes to increase the intensity.
Hold the pose with steady breaths. With each exhale, try to relax your hips a bit more. Hold for 5-10 breaths.
Slowly bring your hands back to the front, pull your right foot back, return to Downward-Facing Dog, and repeat on the other side.

name: Sage Koundinya A
benefits:
Strengthens Arms, Legs, and Core: Builds strength in your upper body, legs, and core by supporting your body weight with your arms and core.
Improves Balance and Focus: Requires a high degree of focus and balance, which helps enhance body coordination.
Stretches the Hips and Legs: The twisting and stretching motion helps open the hips and lengthen the leg muscles.
Enhances Flexibility: Improves overall body flexibility and range of motion.
description:
Start in Downward-Facing Dog with your hands and feet on the floor, forming an inverted 'V' shape with a long spine.
Slowly bend your elbows to a 90-degree angle.
Cross one leg (e.g., your right leg) over to the opposite elbow (your left elbow). Place the back of your right foot on the outside of your left upper arm. Straighten your right leg, pointing your toes forward.
Extend your left leg back, flexing your foot and engaging your leg muscles. You can keep your left toes on the ground or lift the leg completely. Shift your body weight forward, keeping your body parallel to the floor.
Distribute your weight evenly on your hands, engaging your core to stabilize your body. Gaze forward and breathe steadily.
Hold the pose for 3-5 breaths, feeling your body's balance and strength.
Slowly lower your right leg back to the floor and return to Downward-Facing Dog. Repeat on the other side.

name: Foot Behind the Head I
benefits:
Stretches the Spine, Hips, and Legs: The action of bringing the leg behind the head deeply stretches the spine, hips, and leg muscles.
Enhances Flexibility: Improves flexibility in the legs and hips.
Improves Balance: Requires a high degree of balance, which helps enhance body coordination.
Promotes Relaxation: Deep stretching helps relieve body tension and stress.
description:
Start in a seated position with your legs straight.
Bend your right knee and rotate your right leg outward, bringing your right foot close to your right glute.
Place your right ankle on the inside of your left thigh, with the sole of your right foot facing up and your right leg opened outward.
Slowly lean your head forward to create space for your leg.
Bring your right leg over your head, placing your right shin behind your head, as close to the crease of your neck as possible. If you are flexible enough, you can rest your right foot on your left shoulder.
Use your right hand to hold your right leg behind your head, and your left hand to hold your right ankle or shin for stability. Move your right shoulder forward to help secure your leg behind your head with the strength of your shoulder and arm.
Lift your chest and lengthen your spine, keeping it straight. Engage the muscles in your seated leg to stay stable. Bring your hands together in prayer position at your chest, and breathe steadily.
Slowly release your right leg from behind your head and return to the starting position. Repeat on the other side.
aka_chinese: ['单腿头触式','坐立单腿侧伸展']

name: Foot Behind the Head II
benefits:
Stretches the Spine, Hips, and Hamstrings: Deeply stretches the back, hips, and leg muscles.
Strengthens Core: Activates the abdominal core by maintaining balance.
Enhances Flexibility: Helps open the hip joints, relieving stiffness from prolonged sitting.
Promotes Blood Circulation: Improves blood supply to various parts of the body.
Relieves Stress: Deep stretching helps relax the body and mind.
description:
Start in a seated Staff Pose with your legs straight and your spine long.
Bend your right knee and bring your right leg toward your body. Point your right knee to the side, with the sole of your right foot facing your left knee.
Grab your right ankle with your right hand and bring your right shin toward your chest, so your right knee is as close to your right shoulder as possible. Slowly bring your right leg over your head, placing your right shin behind your head and your right ankle at the crease of your neck.
Fix your right leg behind your head using your left shoulder and arm. Move your right shoulder forward to ensure your right leg is stable.
Slowly fold your upper body forward, maintaining a long spine and reaching your chin forward, ensuring your right leg is securely behind your head.
Hold the pose, breathing steadily, and feeling the stretch in your spine, hips, and hamstrings. Hold for 3-5 breaths.
Slowly lift your torso, remove your right leg from behind your head, and return to Staff Pose. Repeat on the other side.

name: Both Feet Behind the Head I
benefits:
Stretches the Spine, Hips, and Hamstrings: The action of bringing both legs behind the head deeply stretches the back, hips, and leg muscles.
Enhances Flexibility: Improves flexibility in the legs and hips.
Improves Balance: Requires a high degree of balance, which helps enhance body coordination.
Promotes Relaxation: Deep stretching helps relieve body tension and stress.
description:
Start in a seated position with your legs straight.
Bend your right knee and rotate your right leg outward, bringing your right foot close to your right glute.
Slightly lean your head forward to create space for your right leg. Place your right shin behind your head and your right ankle at the crease of your neck. Move your right shoulder forward to help stabilize your right leg.
Keep your chest lifted and your spine straight, facing forward. Use your right hand to secure your right leg behind your head.
Bend your left knee and rotate your left leg outward, bringing your left foot close to your left glute.
Use your left hand to place your left foot next to your right foot, trying to bring your ankles close and crossed. Move your left shoulder forward to help stabilize your left leg.
Keep your hands at your sides to help with balance. Slowly bring your hands together in prayer position at your chest, and breathe steadily.
Hold the pose, lengthening your spine with each inhale and relaxing your hips with each exhale. Hold for 3-5 breaths.
Slowly remove both legs from behind your head and return to a seated position.

name: Both Feet Behind the Head II
benefits:
Strengthens Core and Arms: Builds strength in the upper body and abdomen by supporting your body with your arms and core.
Stretches the Spine, Hips, and Hamstrings: Deeply stretches the back, hips, and legs, relieving stiffness from prolonged sitting.
Enhances Flexibility: Improves flexibility in the legs and hips.
Improves Balance: Requires a high degree of balance, which helps enhance body coordination.
Promotes Relaxation: Deep stretching helps relieve body tension and stress.
description:
Start in Both Feet Behind the Head I Pose, with your legs bent and wrapped behind your head, and your feet at the crease of your neck or behind your head.
Place your hands on the floor at your sides, palms down and hip-width apart.
Press into your hands, shifting your weight forward while keeping your spine long.
On an inhale, use your core strength to lift your hips off the ground. Keep your arms straight and your body weight on your hands.
Keep your spine long and your chin lifted to avoid your head sinking. Ensure your ankles are stable behind your head. Breathe steadily, lengthening your spine with each inhale and relaxing your hips with each exhale. Hold for 3-5 breaths.
Slowly lower your hips back to the ground. Remove your legs from behind your head and return to a seated position.

name: Forearm Balance
benefits:
Strengthens Arms and Shoulders: Builds arm and shoulder strength by supporting your body weight.
Improves Focus and Balance: Requires a high degree of concentration and balance, which helps enhance body coordination.
Stretches the Upper and Lower Back: Helps stretch back muscles and relieves back tension.
Strengthens Abdominal Muscles: Activates the abdominal core to enhance core strength.
Tones the Abdominal Area: Core engagement helps tone the abdominal area.
description:
Start in Plank Pose with your hands on the floor and your body in a straight line.
Move your hands forward, bend your elbows, and place your forearms on the floor parallel to each other. Spread your fingers wide and press your knuckles evenly into the ground.
Shift your body weight forward, walk your feet closer to your hands, and lift your hips high, forming an inverted 'V' shape.
Slowly lift your feet, lifting one leg first, followed by the other. Extend your legs straight and upward.
Once your legs are lifted, tuck your pelvis and bring your legs together, keeping your body as perpendicular to the floor as possible. Keep your shoulders away from your ears and your neck relaxed, gazing forward or between your hands.
Engage your abdominal core to stabilize your body and prevent swaying. Lift your chest and lengthen your spine.
Hold the pose for 5-10 breaths, feeling the strength in your arms, shoulders, and core. If you feel stable, try bringing your feet together to further improve your balance.
Slowly lower one leg at a time, returning to Plank Pose or Downward-Facing Dog.

name: Standing Forward Bend
benefits:
Relieves Stress and Mild Depression: Deep stretching and relaxation help calm the mind.
Stimulates Internal Organs: Promotes liver and kidney function.
Stretches Hamstrings, Calves, and Hips: Increases flexibility in the legs and back.
Strengthens Thighs and Knees: Builds leg strength.
Improves Digestion: Abdominal compression promotes a healthy digestive system.
Reduces Fatigue: Relieves tension and fatigue by relaxing the neck and shoulders.
description:
Start in Mountain Pose with your feet together or hip-width apart, and your feet firmly on the ground.
On an inhale, reach your arms straight up, lengthening your spine. On an exhale, fold your body forward from your hips, keeping your spine long and avoiding rounding your lower back. Place your hands on the floor at your sides or grasp your shins or ankles to deepen the forward bend.
Keep your spine straight, your ribs slightly lifted, and your chest close to your thighs. Relax your neck and let your head hang down, but don't put all your weight on your head. Root your feet firmly into the ground and slightly lift your toes to engage your leg muscles.
Hold the pose with steady breaths, lengthening your spine with each inhale and relaxing your body with each exhale. Hold for 5-10 breaths, feeling the stretch in your legs, back, and hips.
On an inhale, reach your hands forward, and slowly lift your torso back to Mountain Pose.

name: Low Push-up
benefits:
Strengthens Arms and Wrists: Builds strength in the arms and wrists by supporting your body weight.
Strengthens Abdominal Core: Activates abdominal core muscles to enhance core stability.
Builds Full-Body Strength: Stretches all body muscles, enhancing overall strength and flexibility.
Improves Posture: Core engagement helps improve daily posture and reduce issues like slouching.
description:
Start in Plank Pose, with your hands on the floor shoulder-width apart and your body in a straight line.
Ensure your palms are flat on the floor, your fingers are spread, and your knuckles are lightly pressed into the ground. Press your toes firmly into the ground and push your heels back.
On an inhale, keep your body stable. Then, on an exhale, bend your elbows and slowly lower your body to about 5 inches (about 13 cm) off the ground. Keep your body parallel to the floor, engage your core, and pull your abdomen toward your spine.
Keep your elbows bent to a 90-degree angle, tucked close to your body and aligned with your wrists. Tuck your pelvis to avoid your lower back from sagging. Gaze downward and breathe steadily. Hold the pose for 3-5 breaths.
On an inhale, push your body back to Plank Pose or move directly into Downward-Facing Dog.

name: Frog
benefits:
